definition: to only want to have a good time/to just want to have fun, and to shy away from self-discipline
to have a voracious desire for/to covet/greedy/corrupt
to play/to have fun/to trifle with/toy/sth used for amusement/curio or antique (Taiwan pr. [wan4])/to keep sth for entertainment

sentences.english: Brittney enjoyed drawing, Anderson recalled. Melonie liked to play.
sentences.chinese: 布蘭妮喜歡畫畫，安德森回憶說，梅隆尼很貪玩。

sentences.english: Mom often asks me not to play computer games too much.
sentences.chinese: 媽媽常跟我說不要太貪玩電腦遊戲。

sentences.english: But when we were together, we were two little kids having fun.
sentences.chinese: 但是當我們在一起時，就是兩個貪玩的小孩子。

sentences.english: Wen Rensui toward the solar country development investigation, the outstanding young which wants to play all the time follows closely step by step.
sentences.chinese: 文仁遂往太陽國開展調查，貪玩的傑仔步步緊隨。

sentences.english: Bob needs to get himself together and stop messing around and wasting his opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 鮑勃需要控制自己，不能再貪玩和浪費機會了。

sentences.english: We picked a little, gray, playful ball of fur.
sentences.chinese: 我們選了一隻毛絨球一樣貪玩的小灰貓。

sentences.english: You naught monkey! Don't play any more.
sentences.chinese: 你這個調皮的猴子，別貪玩了。

sentences.english: Naughty capricious, self-destructive future, junior middle school paid a heavy price.
sentences.chinese: 貪玩任性，自毀前途，初中爲此付出了沉重的代價。

sentences.english: He easily has the tendency Selection Committee, a lazy and fun.
sentences.chinese: 他容易有推委的傾向，也比較懶惰和貪玩。

sentences.english: In films blondes are often assumed as being clueless or as having more fun.
sentences.chinese: 電影裏的金髮女郎往往看起來都很笨，或者貪玩。

definition: to act willfully and make a scene/to make trouble
to be softhearted/to be tenderhearted/to be kindhearted
to do what one is told/obedient
to make trouble without reason (idiom); to be deliberately provocative
to act in a fit of pique/to get in a huff/to be peeved
to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
